definition: as if drunk or entranced (idiom); leading a befuddled existence/in a drunken stupor
intoxicated
to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student
dream/CL:場|场[chang2],個|个[ge4]/(bound form) to dream
to die/impassable/uncrossable/inflexible/rigid/extremely/damned

sentences.english: That magic wine was just a joke she played on me.
sentences.chinese: 其实“醉生梦死”只不过是她跟我开的一个玩笑。

sentences.english: Physical clutter plagues many people in the illusionary chase of possessions.
sentences.chinese: 身体的波动困扰着许多正在为财富醉生梦死的人们。

sentences.english: The young man is leading an aimless life, drinking all the day.
sentences.chinese: 这位年轻人过着没有目标的生活，整天醉生梦死。

sentences.english: Don't lament for the past, don't expect too much in future.
sentences.chinese: 不要悲叹过去，也不要醉生梦死。

definition: lit. dazzling with paper and gold (idiom); fig. indulging in a life of luxury
pleasure seeking (idiom); life of dissipation
lakes of wine and forests of meat (idiom); debauchery/sumptuous entertainment
to spend one's time in drinking and pleasure (idiom); to indulge in sensual pleasures/life of debauchery
drinking party/to go on a binge/to paint the town red
to abandon all restraint (idiom)
lit. to celebrate peace with songs and dance (idiom)/fig. to make a show of happiness and prosperity
lit. dazzling with paper and gold (idiom); fig. indulging in a life of luxury
dead drunk/as drunk as a lord
dead drunk/completely drunk
to loiter/to hang around/dissolute/licentious
lanterns red, wine green (idiom); feasting and pleasure-seeking/debauched and corrupt environment
to live in the moment (idiom)/to live every day as if it were one's last/to enjoy while one can

happy/cheerful
